greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Successive rows of a triangle, the columns of which are generalized Fibonacci sequences S(j).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, >Rows n = 1..125 of table, flattened
Russell Walsmith, CL-Chemy Transforms Fibonacci-Type Sequences to Arrays
formula: The j-th column S(j) is generated by a(n+1) = (n+j)*a(n) + a(n-1), a(0)=0, a(1)=1.
mathematica: t[n_, n_] = 1; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = If[n<k, 0, (n-1)*t[n-1, k] + t[n-2, k]]; row[n_] := With[{ro = Table[t[n, k], {k, 1, n}]}, Join[Reverse[ro], Rest[ro]]]; Array[row, 8] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 05 2016 *)
xref: A001040, A001053, A058307, A058308, A058309 are columns of this triangle.
results.author: _Russell Walsmith_, Dec 07 2000
